content.description:
In praise of Maiestas

1 His bene Maiestas armis defensa deorum

restat, et ex illo tempore culta manet.

Assidet inde Iovi, Iovis est fidissima custos,

et praestatpraesto, -are: maintain sine vi sceptra timenda Iovi.

5Venit et in terras: coluerunt Romulus illam

et Numa, mox alii, tempore quisque suo.

Illa patres in honore pio matresque tuetur,

Illa comes pueris virginibusque venit,

Illa datos fasces commendatcommendo, -are: grace, make attractive eburque curule,ebur curule, n.: the ivory seat of a high magistrate, curule chair

10 Illa coronatis alta triumphat equis.
content.question: A literary device found in line 3 (assidet . . . custos) is

unit.text: 4: Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry and Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 1 and 2

skill.text: 2.A: Describe features and functions of stylistic elements in Latin texts.
